articles.title: Unpacking Copper’s Phantom Deficit
articles.summary: Oilprice.com: Unpacking Copper’s Phantom Deficit. The world's record copper prices are driven not by scarcity, but by massive inventories of metal "economically trapped" in US warehouses as a hedge against rumored tariffs, creating a structural market volatility that benefits speculators over industrial users.

For perspective, it closed out in November 2021, trading around $32 split-adjusted, according to StatMuse, which is about what you’d probably pay for a couple of McDonald’s runs. Sure, ... articles.title: Does Tyra Biosciences (TYRA) Index Inclusion Mark a Turning Point in Its Institutional Story?
articles.mainIdea: Does Tyra Biosciences (TYRA) Index Inclusion Mark a Turning Point in Its Institutional Story?
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: Does Tyra Biosciences (TYRA) Index Inclusion Mark a Turning Point in Its Institutional Story?. Tyra Biosciences was added to the S&P Biotechnology Select Industry Index on December 13, 2025, marking its inclusion alongside a broader group of U.S.-listed biotech peers. This milestone, alongside a recent planned share sale by a major director who still holds a very large stake, highlights growing institutional attention while insider ownership remains substantial. We’ll now examine how Tyra’s inclusion in the S&P Biotechnology Select Industry Index shapes its investment narrative and... Related tickers mentioned: TYRA, ^SPSIBI.

articles.title: Bitcoin briefly trades at $24,000 on Binance’s USD1 pair in flash move
articles.mainIdea: Bitcoin briefly trades at $24,000 on Binance’s USD1 pair in flash move
articles.summary: CoinDesk: Bitcoin briefly trades at $24,000 on Binance’s USD1 pair in flash move. Such sudden price changes are often due to thin liquidity and can be exacerbated by fewer active traders during quieter hours. Related tickers mentioned: BTC-USD.
